title: 114_hr1615
content: The Act titled "DHS FOIA Efficiency Act of 2015" implements the Freedom of Information Act within the Department of Homeland Security. The Chief FOIA Officer of the Department of Homeland Security must update regulations within 90 days of the Act's enactment, providing guidance on procedures for making FOIA requests and implementing automated processing for such requests. The Chief FOIA Officer, in coordination with the Chief Financial Officer and relevant department heads, must identify the total annual cost of implementing section 552 of title 5, United States Code within 90 days of the Act's enactment. Guidance on reporting standards for costs associated with processing FOIA requests must be developed. The Chief FOIA Officer, in collaboration with relevant department heads, must identify and eliminate unnecessary and duplicative actions in processing FOIA requests under section 552(a) of title 5, United States Code within specific timeframes. The Chief FOIA Officer must develop a plan to automate FOIA request processing within 90 days. The plan should consider department components' needs, technology capabilities, costs, and benefits. Additionally, the Chief Privacy Officer, in consultation with the Chief FOIA Officer, must address the FOIA backlog within the same timeframe. The Chief FOIA Officer, in consultation with the Chief Privacy Officer, must update guidance to reduce the backlog in processing FOIA requests by 50% between fiscal year 2015 and fiscal year 2018. The Chief FOIA Officer will include total costs and progress assessment in each semiannual privacy report. The report must assess progress towards reducing the backlog in processing FOIA requests, evaluate staffing and resources adequacy, and review automation progress for requests under section 552(a) of title 5, United States Code. The Chief FOIA Officer's second semiannual privacy report for fiscal year 2016 must include descriptions of cost savings and the plan developed under subsection (d). Duplicative actions are defined as actions carried out by multiple components or programs engaged in the same activities related to processing FOIA requests. The Chief FOIA Officer will provide a plan to automate processing of requests under section 552(a) of title 5, seeking feedback on adoption, costs, and timelines from Department components.
